page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Witheridge lies in the centre of a farming area.The farms vary in size from thirty acres to one hundred and fifty acres.On average they are about one hundred acres.Dairy farming has been the main type but due to new quotas some farmers have changed to beef cattle.Most of the farmers also keep sheep and in this area they are as prevalent as dairy herds.The main dairy breeds are Friesians , Devonshires and Guernseys.The sheep are usually Suffolk cross which are a hardy type for this area. There is very little arable farming. Grass is grown for feeding livestock and for cutting as silage and hay. Most farms grow a little corn or wheat and in many cases one field is used for Turnips.
